meanings.definition: To invest with a fee or feud.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to enfeoff his loyal knight with a piece of land.
meanings.sent2: The lord enfeoffed his vassal with a small estate as a reward for his service.
meanings.sent3: The wizard enfeoffed the talking frog with the ability to speak human languages.
meanings.sent4: The teacher enfeoffed the students with the knowledge to solve complex math problems.
meanings.sent5: The fairy enfeoffed the young girl with the power to control the weather.

meanings.definition: To grant a fee or feud to.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy landowner enfeoffed his son with a large estate upon his retirement.
meanings.sent2: The nobleman enfeoffed the brave knight with a title and a portion of his lands.
meanings.sent3: The chef enfeoffed the hungry customers with a delicious feast fit for royalty.
meanings.sent4: The artist enfeoffed the canvas with vibrant colors that brought the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener enfeoffed the garden with fragrant flowers that attracted butterflies and bees.
